This is a chat only number. true false false false false false false false false false Powered By Digit Digit Insurance Explore Spiritual Places in India Temples in Hyderabad Switch to Digit Insurance Quick Claim Process Affordable Premium Check Premium Check Premium Top 12 Famous Temples in Hyderabad to Visit Hyderabad is home to a plethora of historical and spiritual sites that can be found tucked away among its busy streets. Among them are its temples, which rise majestically as magnificent tributes to faith and culture. A deep sense of tranquillity descends upon entering the center of this bustling metropolis, and the ancient temples dotting Hyderabad's landscape are popular destinations for those seeking this tranquillity. Team Digit Table of Contents Best Temples to Visit in Hyderabad Birla Mandir Chilkur Balaji Temple Jagannath Temple Karmanghat Hanuman Temple Sanghi Temple Akkanna Madanna Mahankali Temple Pedamma Temple Ujjaini Mahankali Temple Jagadguru Adi Shankaracharya’s Shrine Sita Ramachandraswamy Temple ISKCON Temple Balkampet Yallamma Temple Frequently Asked Questions List of Temples in Hyderabad Following is the list of renowned temples in Hyderabad that are conveniently accessible via the nearby Hyderabad Deccan or Nampally Railway Stations, Rajiv Gandhi International Airport, and the Mahatma Gandhi Bus Station: Temples Location Birla Mandir Naubat Pahad Chilkur Balaji Temple Chilkur Jagannath Temple Banjara Hills Karmanghat Hanuman Temple Karmanghat Sanghi Temple Sanghi Nagar Akkanna Madanna Mahankali Temple Shah-Ali-Banda Pedamma Temple Jubilee Hills Ujjaini Mahankali Temple Secunderabad Jagadguru Adi Shankaracharya’s Shrine Dundigal Sita Ramachandraswamy Temple Bhadrachalam ISKCON Temple Nampally Balkampet Yallamma Temple Bjjr Nagar 12 Best Temples to Visit in Hyderabad Explore the list of 12 famous temples in Hyderabad that guide you through the spiritual heartland of India; here are those 12 temples: 1. Birla Mandir | Naubat Pahad The temples of Hyderabad serve as a link between the dynamic present and the city's illustrious past, serving not only as places of worship but also as living reminders of a bygone age. Both the pious, who seek comfort and direction, and the curious. Best Time to Visit: October to February. Temple Timings: 7 am to 12 pm and 3 pm to 9 pm - Every day. Nearby Places: B.M. Birla Planetarium, Birla Science Centre, Shahi Masjid and NTR Garden.   Read more about: Road trips from Hyderabad One day trips from Hyderabad Weekend getaways from Hyderabad 2. Chilkur Balaji Temple | Chilkur One of the well-known temples close to Hyderabad is Chilkur Balaji Temple, which is located nearby. Its exquisite yet understated construction highlights its spiritual core. The temple is a well-liked pilgrimage site since it is thought to grant wishes. Best Time to Visit: October to December. Temple Timings: 5 am to 8 pm - Every day. Nearby Places: Ocean Park India, Elles World, Osman Sagar Lake and Gandipet Lake. 3. Jagannath Temple | Banjara Hills One of Hyderabad's oldest temples, the Jagannath Temple, is tucked away inside the Golkonda Fort and reflects the city's rich temple heritage. The temple provides a calm environment for prayer. It's one of Hyderabad's hidden jewels amid the temples. Best Time to Visit: March to June. Temple Timings: 4 am to 12 pm and 4 pm to 8 pm - Every day. Nearby Places: Antiques Humayun, Hare Krishna Golden Temple, KBR National Park and The Antique Loft. 4. Karmanghat Hanuman Temple | Karmanghat The Karmanghat Hanuman Temple is a representation of tenacity and faith. This well-known temple, located close to Hyderabad, features an amazing fusion of traditional temple architecture. It's a significant location for followers of Hanuman. Best Time to Visit: September to February. Temple Timings: 6 am to 1 pm and 3 pm to 8 pm - Every day. Nearby Places: Kidihou Children’s Museum, Taj Falaknuma Palace, Salar Jung Museum and Nehru Zoological Park.   Know more about: Waterfalls near Hyderabad Best Amusement parks in Hyderabad Best Places to live in Hyderabad 5. Sanghi Temple | Sanghi Nagar Sanghi Temple is renowned for its opulent temple architecture. A visual feast is provided by the magnificent temple complex and detailed carvings. The temple history emphasizes the essence of Hyderabad's historic temples. Best Time to Visit: April to November. Temple Timings: 6 am to 1 pm and 4 pm to 8:30 pm - Every day. Nearby Places: Ramoji Film City, Mount Opera Multi-Theme Park, Antaraganga Waterfalls and Badakonda Waterfalls. 6. Akkanna Madanna Mahankali Temple | Shah-Ali-Banda A special place in Hyderabad's temple history belongs to the Akkanna Madanna Mahankali Temple. The ancient roots of the city are reflected in its architecture. To obtain Goddess Mahankali's blessings, devotees come to this old temple. Best Time to Visit: July to August. Temple Timings: 6 am to 1 pm and 4 pm to 8:30 pm - Every day. Nearby Places: Karmanghat Hanuman Temple, Sri Balaji Temple and Chilkur. 7. Peddamma Temple | Jubilee Hills One of the most well-liked temples in Hyderabad is Peddamma Temple, especially among devotees of the goddess. Tradition and modernity are blended in its architecture. The Bonalu festival is a prominent event in the Hyderabad temple festival. Best Time to Visit: June to July. Temple Timings: 5:30 am to 1 pm and 4 pm to 9 pm - Every day. Nearby Places: Priyadarshini Park, Saroornagar Lake, Nehru Zoological Park and Raymonds Tomb. 8. Ujjaini Mahankali Temple | Secunderabad The magnificent Navaratri celebrations held at Ujjaini Mahankali Temple are well-known. The temple has beautiful architecture and is a reflection of Hyderabad's temple heritage. During Navratri, crowds of devotees swarm this temple. Best Time to Visit: July to August. Temple Timings: 4:30 am to 1 pm and 3 pm to 9 pm - Every day. Nearby Places: Tivoli Cinema, Monda Market, Padmarao Nagar Main Park, and Secunderabad Club. 9. Jagadguru Adi Shankaracharya’s Shrine | Dundigal Hyderabad is home to several Jagadguru Adi Shankaracharya temples. These temples offer a calm setting for introspection and are noteworthy in Hyderabad's temple heritage. Visits in the early morning are advised. Best Time to Visit: April to June. Temple Timings: 6 am to 8 pm - Every day. Nearby Places: Charminar, Golkonda Fort, Qutb Shahi Tombs and NTR Gardens. 10. Sita Ramachandraswamy Temple | Bhadrachalam Hyderabad's Sita Ramachandraswamy Temple is a captivating haven of devotion and spirituality. This historic temple honors Lord Rama and features a special idol of the deity in a reclined position. Devotees seek comfort and blessings. Best Time to Visit: July to July. Temple Timings: 4:30 am to 1 pm and 4 pm to 8 pm - Every day. Nearby Places: Inorbit Mall, Charminar Bazaar, Begum Bazaar, and Ocean Park. 11. ISKCON Temple | Nampally In the center of Hyderabad, the ISKCON Temple serves as both a place of prayer and a haven for spirituality. Its building skillfully combines modern and ancient design features to give guests a calm and serene atmosphere. Best Time to Visit: July to December. Temple Timings: 4:30 am to 8:30 pm - Every day. Nearby Places: Salar Jung Museum, Chowmahalla Palace, Taj Falaknuma Palace, Wonderla Hyderabad, and Chilkur Balaji Temple. 12. Balkampet Yallamma Temple | Bjjr Nagar Hyderabad's most well-known temple to the goddess Yellamma is the Balkampet Yellamma Temple. The temple's long history is intricately woven into the city's cultural fabric, and its architecture features a fusion of traditional South Indian temple design. Best Time to Visit: July to July. Temple Timings: 5 am to 1 pm and 3 pm to 8 pm - Every day. Nearby Places: Shilparamam, Bulkampet Pochamma temple, Inorbit Mall, and Taj Falaknuma Palace. Hyderabad's fame extends beyond its historical monuments; it encompasses its culinary delights, technological advancements, and cultural contributions. With its rich tapestry of tradition and modernity, Hyderabad continues to captivate the world and remains a beacon of dynamism and diversity in India. Visiting hours and entry fees may vary for each temple. It's advisable to check the official websites or contact the respective temples for accurate information regarding timings, and entry fees. Are there any dress code requirements for visiting these temples? While there may not be strict dress code requirements, it's recommended to dress modestly and respectfully when visiting temples. Avoid wearing revealing clothing and ensure that you are appropriately dressed as per traditional customs. Avoid wearing revealing clothing and ensure that you are appropriately dressed as per traditional customs. Which is the most sacred temple in Hyderabad? The Odia community of Hyderabad, India constructed the contemporary Jagannath shrine, a shrine devoted to the Hindu deity Jagannath. As of March, 2024, there were 362 Hindu temples in Hyderabad. As of March, 2024, there were 362 Hindu temples in Hyderabad. Who built the Hyderabad temple? The Hyderabad temple was built in 1976 by the Birla family using imported white marble from Rajasthan. The hillock is located on a 13-acre property and is 280 feet high. The Hyderabad temple was built in 1976 by the Birla family using imported white marble from Rajasthan. The hillock is located on a 13-acre property and is 280 feet high. Which temple is powerful in Hyderabad? Birla Mandir. One of Hyderabad's oldest temples, the Birla Mandir, is perched on a hilltop and is a magnificent example of exquisite artistry. Birla Mandir. The Lord Balaji temple in Hyderabad is the most notable of all the temples. The 500-year-old Chilkur Balaji Temple in Hyderabad was constructed on the banks of Osman Sagar. Which God is Worshipped in Hyderabad? Lord Krishna is the temple's principal deity. Additionally, idols of Sri Jagannatha Baladeva-Subhadra, Sri Radha Madana-Mohana, and Sri Gaura-Nitai are visible. Lord Krishna is the temple's principal deity. Additionally, idols of Sri Jagannatha Baladeva-Subhadra, Sri Radha Madana-Mohana, and Sri Gaura-Nitai are visible. When was the Jagannath temple built in Hyderabad? This temple, which is a duplicate of the real Jagannath Temple in Puri, Odisha, is situated close to Banjara Hills. Despite having only been constructed in 2009, it is regarded as a Hyderabadi architectural monument. Which is the famous marble temple in Hyderabad? The Hindu temple known as Birla Mandir is situated in Hyderabad, Telangana, India, on a 13-acre (53,000-square-meter) tract of land on a 280-foot (85-meter) high mound known as Naubath Pahad. The Hindu temple known as Birla Mandir is situated in Hyderabad, Telangana, India, on a 13-acre (53,000-square-meter) tract of land on a 280-foot (85-meter) high mound known as Naubath Pahad.
